docs.lead_paragraph: Joe was the oldest of five boys in a rural Minnesota family. Having recently graduated from college near the top of his class, he was on his way back to the family farm after attending his best friend's wedding when an oncoming car veered into his lane and struck his car head on, demolishing it and killing Joe. The driver, tests showed, was drunk. Jerry was driving his family home after a two-week vacation when his van was struck by a car speeding down the wrong side of a narrow country road. The driver who left Jerry's wife a widow and their four young children fatherless was drunk. IN an article on ''the bar necessities'' for a party, a leading
